Docs.summary: Specifies the fonts used to display text in Windows display elements.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Each property of the SystemFonts class returns a <xref:System.Drawing.Font> used to display text in a particular Windows display element, such as the title bar of a window. These fonts reflect the current settings in Control Panel.

Docs.value: A that is used to display text in the title bars of windows.

Docs.summary: Gets the default font that applications can use for dialog boxes and forms.
Docs.value: The default of the system. The value returned will vary depending on the user's operating system and the local culture setting of their system.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table describes the value returned by the DefaultFont property depending on the operating system and local culture.
|System and/or culture|Font| |----------------------------|----------| |Windows NT 4x, Japanese version|MS UI Gothic, 9 point| |Arabic Windows|Tahoma, 8 point| |Other operating system/culture|MS Shell Dlg logical font, typically Microsoft Sans Serif, 8 point|
MS Shell Dlg maps to a font set in the system registry.
If the above fonts are not installed, the default font is Tahoma, 8 point. If Tahoma, 8 point, is not installed, DefaultFont returns the value of the <xref:System.Drawing.FontFamily.GenericSansSerif%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Font> returned by DefaultFont does not change when the user is in High Contrast mode. For a font that changes when the user is in High Contrast mode use another system font such as <xref:System.Drawing.SystemFonts.IconTitleFont%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets a font that applications can use for dialog boxes and forms.
Docs.value: A that can be used for dialog boxes and forms, depending on the operating system and local culture setting of the system.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the operating system is Windows 2000 or Windows XP, the DialogFont property returns Tahoma, 8 point. Otherwise, DialogFont returns the value of the <xref:System.Drawing.SystemFonts.DefaultFont%2A> property. The <xref:System.Drawing.Font> returned by DialogFont does not change when the user is in High Contrast mode. For a font that changes when the user is in High Contrast mode use another system font such as <xref:System.Drawing.SystemFonts.IconTitleFont%2A>.
